title: Is NaCl a hygroscopic substance? - Quora

response.answer_text: Literally, Yes it is. Sodium Chloride (NaCl) tend to absorb water from the surroundings when it readily exposed to the air due to strong electron affinity for moisture but it is not enough to form a soultion with the water absorbed. Conversely, it also serves to act as a simple desiccant substance which induces the state of dryness in its vicinity.. Credits : To the questioner (thanks).
